Fields.DialogueText: Olá, Volta. Como está?
Oh! Someone's testing my Portuguese! Not too bad, Capitaine. Bem, Capitaine. I'm well!
Yeah, well, I figured that maybe it'd help if I... I don't know--
Awww! Just connecting with me more, I see! Hahaha! Manli! Good! Maybe while you're at it you can check out these transcripts. I've been meaning to translate these for ages and--

Fields.MenuText: Whoaaaa, now, Volta! Uhm. I just wanted to say hi. Let's start with the basics, okay?
Yeah... no... that's still your job. I'm just passing by before I start barking at someone for FORGETTING TO CLEAN THEIR WEAPON!
No. Non. Não. That's not going to happen. I assigned you that job for a reason.

Fields.DialogueText: Awww, come on, it'll be fun!! Fine. I suppose the basics are okay…
Uh-oh... it's regulated for a reason, soldiers! We'll start a lesson sometime soon then, okay?
Ha! Fine! I'm good at what I do, after all.
Inspections are finished up, we really need to tighten up around here. What do you recommend?
... Hehehe... Well…
What... Why do you have such a... what's with that green-eyed look??
I'm just thinking about certain ancient techniques we can use that can snap them right into shape, Capitaine!
I... I'm just going to say no on whatever it is that you're thinking. Captain's orders. Don't even think about thinking about it.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I'm sorry to say, Capitaine, but I can't stop myself from thinking about thinking what I was thinking. Commanding me not to do that just ensures I'll think about it.
I probably should have phrased it differently. I meant don't talk about it. Can you manage that?
*ALARM*
It seems the Morganas are on my side, here.
You should have phrased that differently, too!
@BATTLE
What... is that? Volta, are you picking anything up?
Hm... yeah... I'm moving us a little closer so I can get a better sense of it.
Let me know as soon as something picks up on the sonar.
WHOA! EVERYONE BRACE FOR EMERGENCY STOP!
Volta, what the hell was that explosion??
We need to tread these waters carefully, Capitaine... this is a sea of mines. And that one? It just damaged the 4th deck. Dispatching a crew, now!

Fields.MenuText: I didn't think we'd hit so close to them. We need to backtrack, immediately.
We're going to need to dock right after this... damn, that puts us off track. All right, let's slowly get the hell out of here.
I should've seen this coming. What are our chances of getting out of this without any more damage?

Fields.DialogueText: I'll start turning us around immediately! But... this will be a slow process. These babies are sensitive.
It puts us off track but that also means the Morganas won't be too big of a problem. I'm moving us now, Capitaine.
No, these mines are expertly made and are hard to track. But as long as we move slowly, I think we'll be okay.
All right, let's move.
When was the last time you set foot on a dock, Volta?
Ah... not since the last time. It feels good to stretch my feet!
In that case, where to first?
Oh? Am I the captain now?

Fields.MenuText: Don't quit your day job, my friend.
Ha! Not even in your dreams!
Let's not get too crazy now…

Fields.DialogueText: Ouch, Capitaine. I'll remember that!
Are you taking my words now?
You haven't seen crazy yet!
But really, there's gotta be one place you're looking forward to.
Shh... shh... I can hear the bustling from here!
W-what?
The yelling, haggling of prices and getting into arguments... The market is around here. Which means I can load up on spices! That way! Come on!
I'm coming, I'm coming! Good grief.
MERDE!
What?? What is it??
Okay. Do you see that store across the way? "Smithson's War Memorabilia"?
Ah! Yeah, what about it? Our next stop?
YOUR next stop, if you don't mind. I can't go any further.

Fields.MenuText: Ah... we've reached the limit already? That's frustrating.
The point of no return... okay then. What're you going to do?
Well, damn. So you want me to go in that shop and get... what exactly?

Fields.DialogueText: YOU'RE TELLING ME!! Por favor? For a friend?
Well I'm sure as hell not standing here! I'm going to circle back and see if I missed anything.
ANYTHING! UGH, you're so lucky... Come on. You've got to go in!
Ha, fine. Fine, I'm going. But uhm... I have no idea what I'd get you!
I'm sure you'll think of something!! Something I can get my hands on, something I can play with!
That... doesn't help me much but, if you insist…
I'm heading back to the ship to keep an eye on the crew...
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
I am happy to see you back, Capitaine! What did you buy?
I think you'll like my haul. I--
*ALARM*
The Morganas aren't on your side THIS time!
You're not going to let me live that down, are you?
@BATTLE
Oo... a book on ancient Rome and the rebellions? How'd you know I loved reading about those epic tales?
Aye, and this dagger here. I liked that rustic gleam it has on the blade, but I figured--
Oo! Is that... GERMAN? World War I... according to this etching on the back here... interesting choice, Capitaine.
Whoops. Well ah, here's a few other things. Get a load off!
Merci, obrigado, thank you! I'm heading to the kitchen to start basting the meat. It's going to be juicy tonight.
Wait... what was that noise?
An... an intruder?! ON MY SHIP?!
Who the HELL are you? Explain yourself before we throw you to the sharks…
I can explain! S'il vous plaît?
You have one minute. 59... 58…
My name is Jean-Luc. I'm just trying to go home! I saw your ship and... and the flag... I... I…slipped on?

Fields.MenuText: Home? How long have you been on my ship? What have you seen?
... Someone's getting discharged as soon as I'm able to clear it. Put him in the brig.
Slipped on, huh? How do you so easily sneak aboard a navy destroyer?

Fields.DialogueText: Okay... okay he's clearly distraught. We'll just... oh what are we going to do with you?
We are not putting this kid in the brig. We'll... think of something. But we're definitely talking to SOMEONE.
Well... I have a LOT of points of entry... very spacious. Plenty of hiding space.
That doesn't help, Volta.
I can work! I will do anything!
Yeah... you'll work, alright…
What in the hell are we going to do?
I'm telegraphing France this instant!
And say what? "Hey, um... this kid somehow made his way thousands of miles from home, and now wants to go back?"
You heard him! He was captured!
And I wonder how he escaped…
By whatever means necessary, Capitaine.

Fields.MenuText: I guess we all need to do what we must if we're going to survive. Especially in times like these…
You're right. Just like we have to do when our backs are against the wall…
Okay... you have a point. Fine. We'll put him to work. Maybe make a fine sailor out of him in time for the draft…

Fields.DialogueText: Exactement. We keep him for now, and figure this all out when we hear back.
Oui. Sometimes we go through the extremes when we feel like there's no other choice.
Of course I do! And great idea, Capitaine. He'll make a fine addition to the Marine Nationale!
Officer Brady! Send word for Jean-Luc!
Oui, Captain?
Well... you may be with us for a bit, so we might as well put you to good use.
Grab a mop, my friend. I'll show you how squeaky clean I like my floors.
Oui, Madame... Thank you, Captain. Thank you!
Yeah... yeah... we'll make sure you're safe and taken care of until we get you home. Okay, shake a leg!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
This book is really good. I should thank the Capitaine again.
*ALARM*
And also curse the Morganas.
@BATTLE
Volta?? Volta!
I believe she's in her quarters, Captain!
Sorry, Capitaine! I was lost in one of the books you got for me.
I hope you found something good. I've been looking for you everywhere!
Nooooot yet - BUT! But, I'm coming close to something good for us.
Well, your track record is phenomenal, I trust you. How about our new recruit?
Jean-Luc? Swabbing, brushing, waxing... doing EVERYTHING as he's told. Not too shabby.
Excellent. I'll have a word with him later. Anything from France?
Yes. They're sending someone along... again…
Hey, Volta, it'll be okay…
I know, I know. Besides... I've been slacking on my knife sharpening…
Uhm... Volta?
Quoi?!
You know what? Never mind. I'll just be somewhere else. Away from those knives of yours…
Jean-Luc! Make sure to put all of the ale barrels in that corner, and please be careful with the wine crates!
Aye, Madame!
Wow you sure are working him hard, Volta. He's getting into tip-top shape!
You should've seen him in my kitchen. I made him scrub the dishes until his hands were dryer than an elephant's ass!

Fields.MenuText: ... I don't even want to know how you came up with that.
W... what?? I mean, I guess that makes sense but…
An elephant's ass, eh? I... okay. I understand that reference. I think.

Fields.DialogueText: It makes more sense in Dagbani.
It translates okay! Elephants are dry. Jean's hands were dry…
Shh... it makes sense, okay?
I... I trust your word.
Capitaine! Capitaine! I think I saw a euhm... a blip? On the sonar!
Good eye, Jean! I'm currently tracking their movements.
Perfect. Let's halt the party prep and get to stations!
@BATTLE
Jean-Luc, are you okay?
N-... non…
You can come out from under there. The Morganas ran. It's safe now!
Snap out of it.
Volta…
You understand that you stowed away on a naval destroyer, right?
M-Madame--
We don't have room for cowards.

Fields.MenuText: Volta, he's shaken. Quit it, now.
Enough. I won't have you speak another word like that to him.
You have a point - but he's a kid, Volta. Step back and let it all sink in.

Fields.DialogueText: You know how I feel about cowards, Capitaine.
... Hmph.
A kid, a couple years shy of fighting this war... Fine.
Jean-Luc, you're scared. That's okay. Come back here when it's time for another fight, but you've been doing a fine job, son.
Okay…
Isn't that right, Volta?
... Sure.
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Now these are our turrets…
Hou la la! Amazing! They're... beautiful!
Beautiful? Huh... they are, aren't they?
Oui…
Look... I'm known to, well…
Be a... firecracker? You explode sometimes? Euhm…
Okay, okay! But, yeah. I wanted to... apologize. Cowardice is... a tough subject for me. But the captain was right. You're a kid, but you've come a long way already. Will you forgive me?
Merci, Madame Belle. I have learned a lot from you and the Captain. One day... one day I will serve the Marine Nationale with bravery!
I think you've earned the right to call me Volta now. And you're right. Besides, you've already got a huge head start!

Fields.MenuText: Wow, that's a better apology than I'll ever get…
Great apology, Volta. That was really sincere.
Huh... I didn't know you had it in you, Volta.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh, please, Capitaine, be happy with the ones I gave you!
Merci, Capitaine. I can be lovely, you know.
Ahh, my beautiful dagger, there you are. Would you like a bite of today?
Ehem, anyway... Jean-Luc, you have plenty of time to gain experience and prepare when you're drafted. Enjoy this time now, hell, enjoy the party! Have a drink! And worry about being a sailor later.
Aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
You know, Capitaine, this is an odd time to propose this, but I think you should work on your Portuguese.
Why Portuguese?
Well, technically you should work on many foreign languages, but Portuguese is one that I can help with - extremely well.
*ALARM*
You're right, this was an odd time.
Well, "Para a batalha!" There is Lesson One.
@BATTLE
Okay, we've done simple greetings, questions, numbers... hmm, what else?

Fields.MenuText: Wait, another Portuguese lesson right now? But what about the party? I think I'd do better with a drink in hand…
But... the party. Let's postpone the lesson and get it started!
Oh, is the ambassador here? Did you hear anyone calling me? Coming!

Fields.DialogueText: Oui, right now! The drinks can wait, and the food isn't quite ready yet. I have Jean-Luc assisting the sous chef with the plating. Now don't change the subject!
Just a second now, Capitaine. Just one more and you'll be free!
Oh, stop that! No one's calling you.
An introduction. And watch the accent, if you please.
Fine. Eu sou seu capitão, e isso está ficando cansativo.
See? Was that so hard?
The plates are ready, and guests are arriving! I believe the ambassador has arrived!
Oh, joy…
Come on, Volta. Let's show him what we're capable of.
Hmm…
What is it, Volta?
I think I'm coming up with something... a new addition to our arsenal.
Oh? Weapons? Armor?
Nuh-uh! It's a secret.

Fields.MenuText: Secret? Hmph. Shouldn't the captain sanction these things anyway?
Not even a hint?? Jeez…
I bet I can guess what it is.

Fields.DialogueText: You can sanction it... or them... when it... or they... get here!
Nope! Not even a gleam…
Okay then, bet! You're preparing dinner next week!
*ALARM*
Captain! Ambassador Noëlle Ardouin arrived, yet Morganas are right on us!
Dammit, all right... Get her to the safe room immediately. Grab Jean-Luc on the way!
Aye, Captain!
@BATTLE
Madame Ambassador, a pleasure! Please, join us for a glass of champagne.
Bonjour, Capitaine! Ah, Volta, your work has been phenomenal.
Huh... uh... merci, Madame.
And this is the, eh... stowaway?
Oui, Madame Ardouin. My name is Jean-Luc.
A fine boy, he is. He escaped capture by the enemy and ended up on our ship.
Besides being a pain in my... I mean. Despite the odds, he's a sharp one, and he deserves to go back home.

Fields.MenuText: Well said.
Exactly. He misses his homeland, and he'll serve it well when the time comes.
He's helped a lot around the ship, and the crew doesn't mind having him around. He'll be just fine returning home.

Fields.DialogueText: Merci, Capitaine.
Mhm, that's right! I mean, yes. He'll do you proud, Madame.
Yes, I can't believe how well he did in the kitchen! I may have to snatch him away here and there…
Hmm... I don't know, Lady Belle... but if the Captain agrees with you, then I'll go with it. Boy, how about you serve me for a little while? Come aboard my ship and we'll sail home to discuss.
Uh... yes! Yes! I would love to, of course.
Did she just…
Shhh... it's fine... it's fine, put the knife away, please.
How about some fish? Volta prepared some amazing bluefin tuna that she and the Captain caught!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Well, the ambassadors seem to be enjoying your fish.
That is not surprising. But--
*ALARM*
I don't mind not having to finish that conversation.
@BATTLE
Is everyone all right?
Aye, Captain!
Ambassador?
Y... yes. A little shaken, but I am well.

Fields.MenuText: Volta, damage report.
Volta, what about you?
Come in, Volta. What's our status?

Fields.DialogueText: A few dents and bruises. Nothing that we can't fix!
Good besides a few scrapes, our engineers are working on it now!
Good to go besides some minimal damage! We're ready to move!
Ohh my, I can't wait to get off this... thing.
Excuse me--
With all due respect, Madame, Volta is a fierce destroyer, and an even fiercer Belle. She welcomed you onto this ship not just because of me, but to show you how capable and strong she is in battle.
Jean…
Good stuff, kid. Couldn't have said it better myself.
Didn't you see the way she moved? The way she attacked?
*ALARM*
Brace yourselves, Volta and Captain, because the Morganas are coming!
@BATTLE
I already miss that kid…
Yeah, he wasn't so bad.
Volta!
Oui, oui. I know…

Fields.MenuText: Her stay wasn't so long, at least?
She sure did drink plenty of champagne…
Hey, think of the positives. You've always been good at that.

Fields.DialogueText: True. Eugh, good riddance!
If she got her hands on my collector's bottles...
Yeah, the positives. At least she's gone!
We should receive a transmission from Jean-Luc when he and the ambassador get back.
Bon. I'm going to send along packages of fish and spices for him to experiment with.
Awww. Look at you, Volta. I didn't realize you liked him that much!
Shut it!
That ambassador, though! She can kiss my--
Okay, Volta... just breathe.
The seas have been quiet…
Aye, the fish aren't biting, either.

Fields.MenuText: Anything on our radar? Sonar?
Check any incoming transmissions, both from Morganas and the other Belles.
All right, just keep your eyes and ears open. I have base on the comms and I'm letting them know what's going on.

Fields.DialogueText: Nothing yet. Huh…
On it, I'll notify you of anything interesting.
Copy that.
How's that research coming along?
Hehehe... it'll... or they'll be ready shortly, Capitaine. How's the dinner planning coming along?
Ha-ha, very funny. Pretty great, actually. You'll see.
Ah! Something just blipped!
About time! I've been itching for a fight!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
TA-DAA!!
They're... lamps.
Not just any lamps! These, Capitaine, are signal lamps.
Huh, you know, I think I heard something about that…
Yeah, a British invention. I gotta give it to the Brits... this is a genius idea. And if you repeat that, I'm stabbing you.

Fields.MenuText: Um. Duly noted.
I'm EXTREMELY happy you're on our side.
Oh yeah? Just try me. I also have tricks up my sleeve.

Fields.DialogueText: Ha! Just teasing ya!
Ohhh come on, Capitaine. I wouldn't stab you for real.
Hehe, you'd make a fun opponent, Capitaine.
Hey, look there. Look through these binoculars. Do you see that?
Hm... aye, Capitaine. Let's signal them…
... Wait…
An ambush! Sound the alarm!
*ALARM*
@BATTLE
That was strange. We don't usually get ambushes.
Look out, Capitaine - that fake merchant ship brought backup!
@BATTLE
Well, that was fun…
Okay, remind me of your definition of fun?
I have to say, that ambush was smart. Disguising themselves as a merchant ship?
I'll send word to the other Belles to keep a lookout for this trap.
Do it now. We have no time to spare.
Je comprends.
Also, take note of inventory. We need to get an accurate count of what we need when next we get to a port. I'm mainly looking for better torpedoes.
Better torpedoes, check! I got a letter from another Belle -- I need to tweak my sonar a bit. I want to see if we can get a better range and possibly watch out for more mines.
Yeah... I just read about the mines that explode from a distance. Do you think you'll be able to read that?
That's the plan. We're clear of them for now... but I wonder…
Well? Don't leave me hanging!
We can send a submarine down, maybe hail another Belle. Maybe we can dismantle a mine or two and use them for our own gain.
Do you think that's possible?
Let me check a few of my books. I may have something about it... hehehe…
I wonder…
What's on your mind, Capitaine?
I wonder if we can use the signal lamps to maybe... blind the Morganas?
You know... that's a good idea, Capitaine!

Fields.MenuText: Let me know exactly when you sense anything, I have a plan.
They have their mists. We can use our own technology to trick them.
If you sense anything, tell me. The plan will begin soon after.

Fields.DialogueText: Keeping my eyes locked. Hehehe, I can't wait to see!
We have to stay one step ahead! I think this plan will succeed.
Roger that!
Spotted, Capitaine! Looks like Morganas.
Perfect. It's time.
Ready when you are!
Let everyone know that we're shutting off our lights, and to put on their night ops. Let's try this out.
@BATTLE
Capitaine... you may want to read this message I translated…
"We have you surrounded... give us your crew, and maybe we'll let you live... " What kind of bull is this?
Captain! Volta!
I sense it now, Houston!
What is it?
Some Morganas not far from us, Captain.
Yeah, I can feel them all right... they don't seem too bad of a threat—
*BOOM*
Is everyone all right? That explosion! Volta?
They're trying to destabilize us! Evading now!
Houston! Go to your station and wait for orders!
Aye, Captain!
Volta, send word to base. We may need reinforcements…
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Looks like more of them are on the way. Keep your guards up!
@BATTLE
Are we still good on explosions?
Oui, Capitaine! I suggest we rock them with more of these, save our big missiles for last.

Fields.MenuText: Let's do it. Add a little oomph on our torpedos...
They're getting on my damn nerves... they think they can take us?
Sounds good to me.

Fields.DialogueText: Aye, Capitaine! Their evasive maneuvers are outstanding... but I'm dead-set on locking onto target!
Same here, Capitaine. Let's scare these bastards.
They are making me nervous... locking onto them now!
Hit?
Hit!! Heh... go on and run back to your mothers!
I've been reading those battle tactic texts you got me. It explains the strategies used both by the Roman Empire and the Carthaginians. Maybe we can use some of them later...
Hannibal of Carthage, huh?
Oui, Capitaine, the one and only. Perhaps the greatest military commander the Roman Republic ever faced…
So... we use smoke while we move full-speed in order to flank them... then use our turrets sort of like our own... surprise cavalry? And then we use the majority of our fuel to charge them?
Exactement! Capitaine, this will work. We just need to move NOW!

Fields.MenuText: No... no, we can't waste our fuel like that. Either we fire what we have now, or we flee and return another day. Okay, get ready to fire!
We can't risk this right now, Volta! We need to fire our mortars, at least. Fire our reserves!
No! We fire, dammit. Give them everything we got!

Fields.DialogueText: They missed, Capitaine…
Capitaine, por favor... they missed…
... Miss.
Then re-load them all!
What are you waiting for?
Capitaine, my plan! We still have a small amount of time!
Volta, this is an order! Fire now!
It won't WORK, Capitaine! I'm sorry.
Wait! Volta!
She's charging, Captain! I can't take over the controls!
Dammit, Volta! Cease!
... I'll never be taken alive, Capitaine. You know that.
VOLTA!!
@BATTLE
*ALARM*
Capitaine...
Look... Capitaine, I did what I had to do in order for us to survive!
Bull! You disobeyed my direct orders and decided to charge the enemy instead of evade, like I told you.
But the idea would have gotten us KILLED!

Fields.MenuText: Volta, even if we set aside the fact that subordinates don't get to decide which of the captain's orders are stupid - you have to know you can trust me!
And that's something you're worried about?! You of all people? You always find ways to surprise me, Volta…
That doesn't matter, and you know that. What's going on?! You've been off for a while, now!

Fields.DialogueText: I DO know that, but sometimes I need to trust my instincts. And they proved true!
... Ei, Capitaine... I know... I just...
Dammit, Volta. What's wrong?
... Okay fine... I still can't believe that happened AGAIN. That fu--that ambassador.
Volta. Wait. First of all, you not killing her isn't cowardice! Why would you even think that??
I just…
*ALARM*
Let's just get to battlestations…
@BATTLE
You know how much I hate cowardice... and yet again I let them walk away without at least letting them have a taste of my knives.
Move us a few clicks further north. We'll intercept the closest convoy and take it for its supplies.
Roger that, moving north. I'll alert you as soon as the convoy appears on our radar.
Good.
Bon...
Are you okay? I was-
No, listen, I have to apolo-
You don't have to-
But I disobeyed direct orders...
Wait... you speak first.
No, you, Capitaine.

Fields.MenuText: You've always been loyal to me and loyal to our nation. But disobeying my orders? I can't allow that.
I've always respected your spit-fire attitude and your will to fight. But disobeying orders will not go under my command.
Your wild-style spirit always gets the crew and me roarin' for a fight... but I can't have you disobeying orders like that. You copy?

Fields.DialogueText: I understand, Capitaine. It was like being backed into a corner, but we had to bite back in some way
Of course, Capitaine.
I copy, Capitaine. I was so riled up, and nothing was working! It was... something I've never experienced before.
But... it saved our lives. YOU saved our lives. And that charge? That was crazy! Okay, maybe we can use that for emergencies... but you can't take any more damage like that.
I understand. I'll make sure to at least warn you before I take control and doom us all to high hell. Or heaven. Deal?
Deal.
So... does this mean we're amigos again?
*ALARM*
Sempre. Always! Who else is going to give you a run for your money during the next fishing challenge?
HA! Funny. You almost had me there. No... not really, though.
@BATTLE
Sem, Capitaine?
Ah, Volta! There you are! I just opened a bottle of wine, and the fish are biting!
Uh... I'm not going to turn down that glass, but what's the occasion? Oo! Is this Sauvignon blanc? You know? I don't care WHAT the occasion is. This is perfect.
I'm celebrating our friendship! Our survival! Wait, wait hold this. I think I got a bite!
I'm just going to down it! Mine too! You're struggling a bit there, Capitaine!

Fields.MenuText: Help me reel it! WHOA, did you see that jump?
I can smell it now... come on, baby, don't even THINK about swimming away with that bait…
Don't let it get away! Ohh man, that line is taut!

Fields.DialogueText: I got this, Captaine! Look at that thing!
I'll move us full speed ahead if need be! It's been a bit too long since a freshly caught fish…
Oh I won't! I'm going in and hauling it back myself if need be!
WE GOT IT! What is it?
A bluefin! A bluefin tuna! EIIII! I'm making that for us tonight! Okay! My turn to catch one! And another glass of wine!
*ALARM*
And yet again... they disrupt…My… fishing time!
The Morganas are in for it this time…
@BATTLE
Today, we celebrate victory. We celebrate gallantry, honor, and rapport.
I'll drink to that!

Not only that, we are here to give away this National Order of the Legion of Honor award. This medal is for someone who highly deserves this and I can't think of a better time to honor them with this.
Mhm! But I wonder who it is... I don't think we discussed this particular medal…

Fields.MenuText: To Volta. Your valor and your high spirits always give us the boost we need. You saved our skins and dammit, you're getting this sooner than later.

Fields.DialogueText: Qu... quoi... wait... for me? I... Capitaine! Somebody pinch me! Actually, don't. You'd better not.
The Legion of Honor award represents your extreme heroism. The willingness to sacrifice for the greater good. The research, and conceptions... the resolutions you come up with... they saved us all.
I can't think of anyone else that deserves this more than you, Volta.
... Thank... thank…
Uh... uhm... here's a napkin! It's okay! Those are happy tears, right?
CAP... CAP... YOU... DAMMIT!
Uhm…
Put it around my neck!
Jeez! Here! Here!
... Merci, Capitain. I... I honestly don't know what to say…
That's a first…
Ei! But really... I thank you. Thank you so much.
You damn well deserve this, Volta. Isn't that right, crew?!
Aye-aye!
Come on... let's stop standing here and celebrate! Pop the cork!

Fields.MenuText: Madame Belle. Your quick thinking and skills came in handy in a pinch. Even if I disagreed... you always come through. I think Hannibal would be proud.

Fields.DialogueText: Me? I... well, haha, yeah. Quick thinking, right? I can't believe this... this medal is for me?

Fields.MenuText: To my friend. You've seen me at my worst and you've always remained loyal, no matter what. I wouldn't have it any other way. Your bravery knows no bounds.

Fields.DialogueText: Capitaine... Oh boy, I need a drink... I... Wow... I…
